data.title: Fix possible NPE in AddListenerAction
Clarify some Javadoc and rename some parameters to be more self-documenting
Fix for bug in RoboVM which may cause ClassCastException in IOSPreferences
data.body: With this fix and the NSDictionary/NSMutableDictionary fixes (https://github.com/robovm/robovm/issues/154) which will be in the next RoboVM nightly IOSPreferences seems to work as expected (at least pax-britannica doesn't crash when turning on sound).

data.title: Fixed StringBuilder.insert
Added icons and splash screens and changed app id and name for SuperJumper to make it ready for App Store
data.body: This is what I submitted to App Store. It can serve as an example of the minimum required to pass Apple's automatic validation (icons and splash screens are required).

data.title: Removed erroneous private method from TableLayout
Added GDX port of Slick2D's AStarPathFinder
data.body:
This is a GDX port of Slick2D's AStarPathFinder which I am currently using. It uses GDX container classes and works without the need of additional memory allocations for a path search.

It may be of use to others too so  I moved it into a gdx package and created this PR.

data.title: Added add(T, float), remove(int), remove(T) and clear() to BinaryHeap
data.body: Added add(T, float), remove(int), remove(T) and clear() methods to BinaryHeap.

data.title: Add a method isPointInPolygon() with vertices passed trough Array<Vector...
data.body: ...2> instead of List<Vector2>. Mark old method as deprecated and use an auxiliary method for the main code for both functions.

data.title: Minor tweaks to the Sprite class.
data.body: Documented a few Sprite methods, and changed parameter "degrees" to "radians" in the setRotation() methods, because Sprites don't actually render their rotation in degrees.

data.title: 3dapi: add basic shadow mapping
data.body:
Small warning upfront: This changes the uniforms used by the DefaultShader, if someone has a custom implementation based on those it probably needs to be changed also. Previously the uniform u_projTrans was set to the Camera.combined matrix, this change sets it to Camera.projection and adds additional uniforms, like u_projViewTrans which is set to Camera.combined.

https://github.com/xoppa/libgdx/commit/9f56fefef0da7512bcff3d5250e50dd390029b1d: add DepthShader and DepthShaderProvider. The implementation is very basic, the glsl files are on the class path (might require a GWT change). Only two options skinned/non-skinned, blending (based on e.g. diffuse texture) is not implemented yet.

 I'm not very happy with this solution, but its better than nothing I guess. Implementing a good depth/shadow shader (depth textures, cubemaps) requires a more fundamental change (mainly Texture and FrameBuffer) and can be device specific, e.g.:
- The GL20 interface doesn't provide all LWJGL OpenGL functions (like glDrawBuffers)
- afaik iOS always supports OES_depth_texture (and OES_depth_texture_cube_map?) 
- on Android its of course GPU specific, but can be checked against extensions (e.g on my Adreno its a NV extension)

https://github.com/xoppa/libgdx/commit/f36cc96f7a1398470d199047ea4d207a4d46c2e3: add ShadowMap interface (provides a Texture and Matrix4). Added DirectionalShadowLight class, a shadowMap member to the Lights class and shadow mapping to the DefaultShader. Because of above reasons and this being a first draft and likely to be changed, I marked them as deprecated.

https://github.com/xoppa/libgdx/commit/8b702873f2cdc19476c699acb2c6e248ab665987: Add shadow mapping to the Bullet and Animation3D tests.

data.title: Multi-Page Fonts & Tightly Packed FreeType Glyphs
data.body:
# FRESH PULL REQUEST

This focuses on two features for bitmap fonts:
- FreeTypeFontGenerator allows the user to specify their own PixmapPacker. This allows for tightly packing many glyphs into a single page.
- BitmapFont, BitmapFontCache, and FreeTypeFontGenerator now support BMFont files with multiple glyphs pages.

As a result, `BitmapFontData.imagePath` and `BitmapFontData.getImagePath()` have been deprecated, and replaced by `imagePaths[]` and `getImagePath(int index)`. Likewise, the same has been done with the `getTextureRegion()` method of FreeTypeBitmapFontData. These could be removed if we're OK with breaking old code. 

Users are encouraged to use `BitmapFont.getRegions()` and the TextureRegion[] constructor for greater compatibility with font files. I did not deprecate `BitmapFont.getRegion()` -- although maybe it should be, for consistency's sake.

See the CHANGES file, as well as FreeTypePackTest and BitmapFontTest. 
## BitmapFontWriter

A utility in the gdx-tools package for writing bitmap font data to text or XML format -- can be used after generating with FreeType to cache the generated fonts and improve load time on mobile.
## Future Thoughts:

I am currently working on a tool which allows you to specify many BMFont files and TTF files, and it will **tightly** pack all their glyphs into the same texture(s). It then produces a JSON file with details for each FNT (size, name, etc), and ultimately a FontMapper class to facilitate the loading of them. I feel this does not quite belong in the LibGDX codebase; at least not until markup/multi-font text is added to scene2D and BitmapFontCache.

data.title: Added bounding box for particle effects.
data.body:
It can be useful to have the bounds of a particle effect (I need it for a depth test in a sorting algorithm for rendering a 2.5d view). This PR adds this functionality.

Note that I used  BoundingBox with z set to 0 as there is no equivalent for 2D.

data.title: ParticleEmitter now resets the active particles too.
chmod -x a lot of .java source files
update Preferences.java doc to warn of Pref name collisions
RoboVM IOSInput will now take current interface orientation into consideration when reading accelerometer values
data.body: The x and y values from the accelerometer have to be swapped and mirrored depending on the current interface orientation.

data.title: MeshBuilder, fix .patch() indices, issue 1629
Remove test code
Texture, add unsafeSetWrap and unsafeSetFilter (and some other changes)
data.body:
The glTexParameter values are stored with the texture, but DefaultTextureBinder caches them with the bind unit, resulting into parameters not set (see issue 1650).

The best place to store the texture context (glTexParameter values) would be in the Texture class, but that leads to three problems:
- Texture always (re)binds the texture on setWrap and setFilter
- Texture always sets the parameter, even if its the same
- Texture forces you to use the TextureWrap and TextureFilter enums

For the first two problems I added the unsafeSetWrap and unsafeSetFilter methods, which assumes the texture is already bound and compares the previous value to avoid unneeded GL calls.

For the third problem I changed TextureDescriptor to use the TextureWrap and TextureFilter enums. Which I think for those values is fine. I haven't looked into other values yet (swizzle etc.).

On a side note: I can see how this can cause other problems e.g. when using 3d or depth textures (it might require DepthComponent (and consorts) to be added to the Format enum of Pixmap and perhaps the Gdx2DPixmap equivalent). I haven't looked in depth into this.

data.title: Sound and Music for RoboVM-based iOS backend using ObjectAL.
data.body:
This adds Sound and Music support on iOS when using the RoboVM backend. The ObjectAL static library is assumed to be located in

```
gdx/libs/ios32/libObjectAL.a
```

as a fat library containing both arm and x86 versions of ObjectAL. This patch does not include code to build ObjectAL. Here's how I'm building it:

```
tar xvfz kstenerud-ObjectAL-for-iPhone-v2.2-0-gebd5a1e.tar.gz 
cd kstenerud-ObjectAL-for-iPhone-ebd5a1e/ObjectAL
xcodebuild -arch armv7 -sdk iphoneos
xcodebuild -arch i386 -sdk iphonesimulator
lipo build/Release-iphoneos/libObjectAL.a build/Release-iphonesimulator/libObjectAL.a -create -output build/libObjectAL.a
cp build/libObjectAL.a ~/Projects/libgdx/gdx/libs/ios32/
```

Note that this requires the latest RoboVM 0.0.4-SNAPSHOT nightly to be used. I will release a 0.0.4 version some time next week.
